text.text_translated:
In Britain, people spend a lot of money on new clothes.
Each person spends more than £1,000 every year.
This is about 4% of the money they get from their job.
This does not sound like a lot.
But it hides two serious problems for people and for the world.
The first problem is that people spend money they do not have.
They use credit cards to buy clothes.
Each adult in Britain must pay back about £670.
This is 66% of the money they spend on clothes.
The second problem is that people buy things they do not need.
Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothes every year.
Most of these clothes go to big places for rubbish.
